—William Shakespeare,
Troilus and Cressida
name: Naturalize
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
title: Naturalize

flavor: The song of the forest is in perfect harmony. If a single note is out of place, the elves will find its source.
name: Norwood Ranger
title: Norwood Ranger

flavor:
To renew the land, plow the land.
To destroy the land, do nothing.
—Druids' saying
name: Plow Under
text: Put two target lands on top of their owners' libraries.
title: Plow Under

flavor: It has germinated in the earth for thousands of years. Finally it wakes to the battle's call.
name: Primeval Force
text: When Primeval Force enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you sacrifice three Forests.
title: Primeval Force

flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.
name: Rampant Growth
text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
title: Rampant Growth

flavor:
Why should death always have the last word?"
—Llanowar druid
name: Regeneration
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
title: Regeneration

flavor: Even what is lost beyond recall returns when coaxed by a dryad's hand.
name: Revive
text: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.
title: Revive

name: Rhox
text:
You may have Rhox assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
{2}{G}: Regenerate Rhox. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
title: Rhox

flavor: To a dryad, every tree in the forest is both a doorway and a window.
name: Rushwood Dryad
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
title: Rushwood Dryad

flavor:
I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now that's a plan"
—Wandering mage
name: Spined Wurm
title: Spined Wurm

name: Spitting Spider
text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Sacrifice a land: Spitting Spider deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.
title: Spitting Spider

name: Spreading Algae
text:
Enchant Swamp
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.
When Spreading Algae is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Spreading Algae to its owner's hand.
title: Spreading Algae

name: Stream of Life
text: Target player gains X life.
title: Stream of Life

flavor: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.
name: Thorn Elemental
text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
title: Thorn Elemental

flavor: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.
name: Trained Armodon
title: Trained Armodon

flavor:
Graceful? Yes. Beautiful? Absolutely. Harmless? Definitely not."
—Fyndhorn elder
name: Verduran Enchantress
text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
title: Verduran Enchantress

flavor: The sun breaks, the beasts stir, and the forest awakens to stand against its enemies.
name: Vernal Bloom
text: Whenever a Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
title: Vernal Bloom

flavor: Nature twists knots stronger than any rope.
name: Vine Trellis
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
title: Vine Trellis

flavor:
We are the hands of the great trees, reaching out to ensnare what threatens their branches."
—Elvish hunter
name: Wing Snare
text: Destroy target creature with flying.
title: Wing Snare

flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.
name: Wood Elves
text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
title: Wood Elves

flavor: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.
name: Yavimaya Enchantress
text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
title: Yavimaya Enchantress

flavor:
A good lamp will light your way. A good ring will clear it."
—Nervan, royal jeweler
name: Aladdin's Ring
text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
title: Aladdin's Ring

flavor: The heavier the load, the harder it works.
name: Beast of Burden
text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
title: Beast of Burden

name: Brass Herald
text:
As Brass Herald enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
When Brass Herald enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all creature cards of the chosen type revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
Creatures of the chosen type get +1/+1.
title: Brass Herald

flavor:
Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."
—Mogg march
name: Coat of Arms
text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
title: Coat of Arms

flavor: Polished by a thousand waves.
name: Crystal Rod
text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
title: Crystal Rod

flavor:
A good deal of tyranny goes by the name of protection."
—Crystal Eastman,
"Equality or Protection
name: Defense Grid
text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.
title: Defense Grid

flavor: Legend has it that the world was hatched from a dingus egg.
name: Dingus Egg
text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
title: Dingus Egg

flavor: True power is controlling not only the hearts of your subjects, but their minds as well.
name: Disrupting Scepter
text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.
title: Disrupting Scepter

flavor:
The Eye altering alters all."
—William Blake, "The Mental Traveller
name: Distorting Lens
text: {T}: Target permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
title: Distorting Lens

flavor:
Why build a bridge that needs to be guarded?"
—Elvish champion
name: Ensnaring Bridge
text: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.
title: Ensnaring Bridge

flavor: Woven from strands of griffin mane and pegasus tail.
name: Flying Carpet
text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
title: Flying Carpet

flavor:
Step 1: Find your cousin.
Step 2: Get your cousin in the cannon.
Step 3: Find another cousin.
name: Fodder Cannon
text: {4}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Fodder Cannon deals 4 damage to target creature.
title: Fodder Cannon

flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.
name: Howling Mine
text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
title: Howling Mine

flavor: Forged by a thousand flames.
name: Iron Star
text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
title: Iron Star

flavor: Blessed by a thousand prayers.
name: Ivory Cup
text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
title: Ivory Cup

flavor:
Knowledge is power."
—Sir Francis Bacon, Meditationes Sacrae
name: Jayemdae Tome
text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
title: Jayemdae Tome

flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.
name: Millstone
text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

flavor: Its wings were only designed to be ornamental, but it learned to use them on its own.
name: Patagia Golem
text: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.

name: Phyrexian Colossus
text:
Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.
Pay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.
Phyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.
title: Phyrexian Colossus

flavor:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.
It doesn't laugh or cry.
All it does from dusk till dawn
Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme
name: Phyrexian Hulk
title: Phyrexian Hulk

flavor: These devices have been known to pull entire worlds through the Æther.
name: Planar Portal
text: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

flavor: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.
name: Rod of Ruin
text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

flavor: Though lifeless, the skull still possessed a strange power over the flow of magic.

text: {5}, {T}: Return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

flavor: Knowledge knows no bounds.
name: Spellbook
text: You have no maximum hand size.

flavor: It doesn't point north. It points home.
name: Star Compass
text:
Star Compass enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a basic land you control could produce.
title: Star Compass

text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

flavor: Tainted by a thousand fears.
name: Throne of Bone
text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

flavor: Urza protected his body well, but neglected his soul.
name: Urza's Armor

text: {3}, {T}: Target player names a card, then reveals the top card of his or her library. If it's the named card, the player puts it into his or her hand. Otherwise, the player puts it into his or her graveyard and Vexing Arcanix deals 2 damage to him or her.
title: Vexing Arcanix

flavor:
A stick is your friend. A pointed stick is your good friend. An army of pointed sticks is your best friend."
—Onean sergeant

Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike

text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.

text:
Coastal Tower enters the battlefield tapped.

Elfhame Palace enters the battlefield tapped.

Only death breeds in stagnant water.

flavor: Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the ‘training' I needed.

flavor: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.

text: Destroy target tapped creature.

flavor:
Before my eyes was a horrible monster, worthy to figure in the legends of the marvellous. . . . Its eight arms, or rather feet, fixed to its head . . . were twice as long as its body, and were twisted like the furies' hair."
—Jules Verne, Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea, trans. Lewis
name: Giant Octopus
title: Giant Octopus

flavor: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.
